p: When investigating brain-specific reactions onto OmEO-based aromatherapy, a significantly lower number of BDNF mRNA copies were determined in Aβ1-42 pretreated rats (II) compared to the sham-operated rats (I) ( p < 0.0001) ( Figure 6). In addition, it was observed that OmEO attenuated the damage induced by Aβ1-42 administration, as judged from a significant increase in BDNF expression being detected in the Aβ1-42 pretreated rats that inhaled the 1% concentration of the essential oil (III) ( p = 0.0023). Yet, the 3% concentration of the OmEO (IV) was found to be somewhat less efficient in counteracting the harmful effects of Aβ1-42 ( p = 0.08351) ( Figure 6).
